description.originalText:
We were lucky enough to find Victoria when we needed her most. She worked with our dad for the last two years of his life. My sister and I live out of state, so finding someone we could count on was crucial, and that’s Victoria. She is so big-hearted, kind, dependable, thorough, and quite fascinating. She pulled my dad back from the brink of a sudden illness several times with her careful observations of his behavior changes, breathing issues, you name it.
Dad was bedridden, with Parkinsonian traits, Lewy body dementia, and incontinence. Along with 4 diaper changes a day, Victoria kept him bathed, well fed, and entertained with her company, she’s had an amazing life. 
Dad had a lot of interests and Victoria always found new things on YouTube to keep him engaged. My Dad was really happy being so well taken care of, and he became a nicer man I think because of the kindness she gave.
She made so many of the arrangements to move Dad from the nursing home back to his apartment, she found and hired Dad’s other beloved caretaker and managed the work schedules, ordered the groceries.
Having gone through a string of caretakers who left us constantly on edge for the next no-show or worse, Victoria made us feel safe and sane, she was trustworthy, everyone who met her in our building told us what a gem we had.  What a gift she was.

description.displayText: Victoria was a complete godsend for both my mother and our family!
description.originalText: Victoria was a complete godsend for both my mother and our family!

I knew that I wanted to hire Victoria to take care of my then 91 year old father as soon as I spoke to her on the phone. She thankfully became his caregiver and was with him up to his passing on December 30, 2024 (almost 2 years). Victoria has a 
wealth of knowledge about eldercare and literally saved my father's life on several occasions by cueing in to his symptoms and acting quickly. She is passionate, brilliant and kept my dad well fed, entertained, clean and healthy. She is reliable 100 percent of the time. She hired and managed care takers when some moved on. Honestly, she is a Godsend. Hire her and you wont be disappointed.

description.displayText:
Victoria was a life saver when i had my hip replacement surgery. I live in a 5 story walk up so help was extremely necessary. Victoria was there for me every day. She did my shopping, prepared light meals, took care of my cats. Escorted me to my doctors appointments. My husband works at night. She spent many nights sleeping on my couch until my husband returned home very early in the mornings. She helped bathe me and so much more i could go on forever. I know Victoria from my neighborhood .
she has always been the go to person for anyone in need of help, advice or a shoulder to cry on.  I found her as she has a web page that is dedicated to compassionate care amongst the neighbors in our area. I can't recommend her highly enough. She is one of a kind.!
